Ethiopia - Petroleum Exploration

repnme.cdata!:
Ethiopia - Petroleum Exploration Promotion
            and Geothermal Reconnaissance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project will support the
            efforts of the Ethiopian Ministry of Mines and Energy to
            attract renewed exploration efforts by international oil
            companies and to establish the feasibility of geothermal
            energy development. The project consists of two components:
            (a) An exploration promotion component consisting of: (i)
            technical assistance to the Ministry of Mines and Energy in
            promoting Ethiopia's petroleum, assisting in the
            negotiation of exploration contracts with oil companies, and
            monitoring the activities of operating companies; (ii)
            acquisition of about 800 line-km of offshore seismic data
            and the reprocessing of about 3,000 line-km of existing
            seismic data; (iii) training of key Ministry of Mines and
            Energy staff; (iv) special studies, particularly on the
            potential use of natural gas domestically; and (v) equipment
            for the above. (b) A geothermal reconnaissance component
            consisting of: (i) consulting services to evaluate the
            feasibility of developing geothermal sites northeast of
            Addis Ababa; (ii) assistance in developing an overall
            strategy for geothermal development; and (iii) training and
            equipment for the above.
